Overview

ServicesQueryBinder contains methods for accessing services.

Constant Summary collapse

SERVICE_DETAIL_FRAGMENT =

Default service detail fragment. This defines what fields to return for the service.

Returns:

  • (String) 
<<-'GRAPHQL'
  fragment ServiceDetail on Service {
    id
    name
    longName
    kind
    description
    qos
    repositoryURL
    productManager {
      ...OwnerDetail
    }
    maintainer {
      ...OwnerDetail
    }
    team {
      ...OwnerDetail
    }
    execSponsor {
      ...OwnerDetail
    }
    volunteers {
      nodes {
        ...OwnerDetail
      }
    }
    froms {
      nodes {
        job
        source
        sourceLastUpdated
      }
    }
    slos {
      totalCount
    }
  }
  fragment OwnerDetail on Owner {
    id
    name
    active
  }
GRAPHQL
SERVICE_LINK_DETAIL_FRAGMENT =

Default service link detail fragment. This defines what fields to return for the ServiceLink.

Returns:

  • (String) 
<<~GRAPHQL
  fragment ServiceLinkDetail on ServiceLink {
    id
    name
    description
    url
    kind
    source
  }
GRAPHQL

#add_service_dependency(**kwargs) ⇒ Response

Add a dependency for a given service.

Parameters:

  • client (Client) —

    The client to use to query

  • context (Hash) —

    Added context to add to the request as headers

  • service_name (String) —

    The name of the service that requires the dependency

  • dependency_name (String) —

    The name of the service that provides the dependency

Returns:

  • (Response)

#list(**kwargs) ⇒ Response

List all Services in the Service Catalog.

Parameters:

  • name (String) —

    (optional) Filter by name substring

  • kind (String) —

    (optional) Filter by kind of Service

  • has_slos (Boolean) —

    (optional) Filter by presence of SLOs

  • has_maintainer (Boolean) —

    (optional) Filter by presence of maintainer field

  • name_with_owner (String) —

    (optional) Filter by name with owner in repository URL

  • search (String) —

    (optional) Filter by name, description, or long name substring

  • context (Hash) —

    (optional) Optional headers to add to the request

Returns:

  • (Response) —

    All services matching the criteria

#update_service(**kwargs) ⇒ Response

Create or update a service.

Parameters:

  • client (ServiceCatalog::Client) —

    The ServiceCatalog::Client

  • context (Hash) —

    Additional headers to add to the request (optional)

  • name (String) —

    The name of the service (no spaces)

  • long_name (String) —

    The friendly name of the service (Title Case)

  • description (String) —

    A sentence that describes what the service does.

  • kind (String) —

    A sentence that describes what the service does.

  • repository_url (String) —

    A link to the service's project or code repository.

  • qos (String) —

    The Quality of Service provided (e.g. critical, experimental, deprecated)

  • owners (ServiceOwner) —

    A list of ServiceOwner objects describing an owner and their relationship to the service. “hubot”, kind: “maintainer”

  • source_kind (String) —

    The source responsible for populating this information (e.g. a background job, web)

  • source_last_updated (Time) —

    The time the ownership source data last changed.

  • source_url (String) —

    A URL pointing to the source of the ownership information.

Returns:

  • (Response) 


165
166
167
 
# File 'lib/service-catalog/client/services_query_binder.rb', line 165

def update_service(**kwargs)
  Response.new Client::Services::UpdateServiceMutation.execute(client: client, **kwargs)
end

#update_support_level(**kwargs) ⇒ Response

Update a support level for a given service. If it does not exist, it will be created.

Parameters:

  • client_mutation_id (String) —

    A unique identifier for the client performing the mutation.

  • issue (String) —

    The GitHub issue URL associated with this Service

  • level (String) —

    The severity of a support request

  • pagerduty (String) —

    The Pagerduty escalation policy URL associated with this Service

  • service_name (String) —

    The name of the service whose support level you're removing (exact)

  • slack (String) —

    The Slack channel associated with this Service

  • tta (String) —

    How long to wait for an acknowledgement

  • context (Hash) —

    Additional headers to add to the request (optional)

Returns:

  • (Response)

88
89

def update_support_level(**kwargs)
  Response.new Client::Services::UpdateSupportLevelMutation.execute(client: client, **kwargs)
end
